alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Greenwood; Laurens; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 6:20PM EST until January 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Laurens County in Upstate South Carolina... East central Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... South central Union County in Upstate South Carolina... Greenwood County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 700 PM EST. * At 619 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles southwest of Greenwood, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Greenwood, Ninety Six and Ninety Six Historic Site around 630 PM EST. Lake Greenwood, Lake Greenwood State Park, Greenwood State Park and Cross Hill around 640 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this dangerous thunderstorm include Coronaca, Bradley, Mountville, Promised Land and Dyson. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
